smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function mainSettingsEspressoTest is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function invalidate is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onPreferenceChange appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'SettingsFragment' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: NotImplementedDeclaration
smells.description: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. Hence, the NotImplementedDeclaration should only serve as a temporary declaration. Before releasing, this type of declaration should be removed.

instances.message: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. Hence, the NotImplementedDeclaration should only serve as a temporary declaration. Before releasing, this type of declaration should be removed.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

smells.name: ExplicitGarbageCollectionCall
smells.description: Don't try to be smarter than the JVM. Your code should work independently if the garbage collector is disabled or not. If you face memory issues, try tuning the JVM options instead of relying on code itself.

instances.message: An explicit call to the Garbage Collector as in System should not be made.

smells.name: LateinitUsage
smells.description: Usage of lateinit detected. Using lateinit for property initialization is error prone, try using constructor injection or delegation.

instances.message: Usages of latinit should be avoided.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function onPreferenceChange has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.support.v7.preference.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ( { activity.finish() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
